title: Authors and Citation
text: Paul J. Northrop. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Northrop PJ (2025). accessr: Command Line Tools Produce Accessible Documents using 'R Markdown'. R package version 1.1.3, https://paulnorthrop.github.io/accessr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {accessr: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using 'R Markdown'},   author = {Paul J. Northrop},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.1.3},   url = {https://paulnorthrop.github.io/accessr/}, }

what: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R Markdown
title: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R Markdown
text: package provides functions produce accessible html slides, html, Word PDF documents input R markdown files. Accessible PDF files produced Windows Operating System. One aspect accessibility providing headings recognised screen reader, providing navigational tool blind partially-sighted person. main aim enable documents different formats produced single R markdown source file using one function call. render() function rmarkdown package used render R markdown files. zip file containing multiple files can produced one function call. user-supplied template Word document can used determine formatting output Word document. Accessible PDF files produced Word documents using OfficeToPDF. convenience function, install_otp() provided install software. option print html output (non-accessible) PDF files also available. Additional features. output format Word document function ext_img() enables knitr chunk options .width /.height used set dimensions figure (R-generated external image). Passing (default) slide_level = 1 rmd2ioslides() enables use level one header # separate slides ioslides presentation without producing grey segue slides.

title: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R Markdown
text: main functions : rmd2word(): create word documents accessible PDF files. rmd2ioslides(), rmd2slidy(): create ioslides/slidy presentations perhaps print (non-accessible) PDF documents. rmd2html(): create html documents perhaps print (non-accessible) PDF documents. rmd2many(): create HTML slides, PDF slides, Word PDF documents single R markdown file.

title: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R Markdown
text: Suppose current working directory R markdown files file1.Rmd file2.Rmd, template Word file your_template.docx file OfficeToPDF.exe downloaded OfficeToPDF releases can accessed. following code creates files file1.docx, file2.docx, file1.pdf file2.pdf working directory , unless supply zip = FALSE, zip file accessr_word.zip containing two PDF files also created. path Word template document can provided using doc argument. doc provided default template used. See ?rmd2word details. include figures knitr chunk option fig.alt can used set alternative text. may find need enclose LaTeX maths environments $$ … $$ typesetting mathematics. path OfficeToPDF.exe can provided using argument dir. dir missing rmd2word look OfficeToPDF.exe default installation directory dir install_otp.
code: rmd2word(c("file1", "file2"), doc = "your_template.docx")

title: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R Markdown
text: Similarly, function rmd2ioslides produces HTML ioslides presentations. argument pdf = TRUE supplied chrome_print function pagedown package used produce (non-accessible) PDF files slides. requires secure internet connection. See ?rmd2ioslides. rmd2slidy (see slidy presentations) rmd2html work similar way.
code: rmd2ioslides(c("file1", "file2"))

title: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R Markdown
text: Executing following code copy file example.Rmd working directory create output Word document, html document ioslides slidy presentations. working directory also files example.docx, example.pdf example.html. latter contains slidy presentation final three calls create example.html, overwritten. example file includes examples creating figures tables notes potential issues typesetting mathematics creating Word output. particular, knitr chunk options fig.alt fig.cap can used create separate alternative text caption figure. also features use input list params named parameters, component hide can used hide selected parts output.
code: rmd_file <- system.file(package = "accessr", "examples", "example.Rmd") file.copy(from = rmd_file, to = getwd()) rmd2word("example") rmd2html("example") rmd2ioslides("example") rmd2slidy("example")

title: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R Markdown
text: used rmd2ioslides create HTML lecture presentations rmd2word create accessible PDF document versions presentations upload, pre- post- lecture, Virtual Learning Environment (Moodle). default setting rmd2many produces files Word document 18pt bold text. latter may particularly useful students. use params$hide (see ) hide selected content file share students prior lecture.

title: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R Markdown
text: get current released version CRAN:
code: install.packages("accessr")

title: Internal accessr functions — accessr-internal
text: Internal accessr functions

title: Internal accessr functions — accessr-internal
code: rmd2presentation(   x,   format = c("ioslides", "slidy"),   zip = TRUE,   pdf = FALSE,   zip_pdf = zip,   pdf_args = list(),   add = FALSE,   quiet = TRUE,   rm_html = FALSE,   rm_pdf = FALSE,   inc_rmd = FALSE,   params = NULL,   ... )  accessr_zip(x, dnames, udnames, zipfile, add, extension)  ioslides_presentation_accessr(   number_sections = FALSE,   logo = NULL,   slide_level = 2,   incremental = FALSE,   fig_width = 7.5,   fig_height = 4.5,   fig_retina = 2,   fig_caption = TRUE,   dev = "png",   df_print = "default",   smart = TRUE,   self_contained = TRUE,   widescreen = FALSE,   smaller = FALSE,   transition = "default",   math_method = "mathjax",   mathjax = "default",   analytics = NULL,   template = NULL,   css = NULL,   includes = NULL,   keep_md = FALSE,   lib_dir = NULL,   md_extensions = NULL,   pandoc_args = NULL,   extra_dependencies = NULL,   ... )  html_dependency_ioslides(slide_level)  check_math_argument(math)  mathjax_to_math(mathjax, math)  pkg_file(..., package = "rmarkdown", mustWork = FALSE)  devtools_loaded(x)  dir_exists(x)  citeproc_required(yaml_front_matter, input_lines = NULL)  read_utf8(file)  write_utf8(text, con, ...)  is_windows()  pandoc2.0()  base64_encode_images(html)  process_images(html, processor)  process_html_res(html, reg, processor)  stop2(...)  normalized_relative_to(dir, file)

title: Internal accessr functions — accessr-internal
text: functions intended called user.

what: accessr: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R markdown — accessr-package
title: accessr: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R markdown — accessr-package
text: Provides functions produce accessible HTML PDF documents input R markdown files. Currently, accessr provides option produce accessible PDF files Windows Operating System. One aspect accessibility providing headings structure recognised screen reader, providing navigational tool blind partially-sighted person. key aim produce documents different formats collection R markdown source files. user-supplied template Word document can used determine formatting output Word document. Similar functions produce HTML slides HTML documents. zip file containing multiple files can produced. option print HTML output (non-accessible) PDF files also available.

title: accessr: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R markdown — accessr-package
text: See accessr package page Github information.  example Rmd file available system.file(package = "accessr", "examples", "example.Rmd"). Windows Operating System, Accessible PDF documents produced creating Word documents R markdown files PDF documents Word documents.  first step uses render function rmarkdown package rdocx_document function officedown package. second step uses OfficeToPDF. main functions accessr : rmd2many: create HTML slides, PDF slides, Word PDF documents single R markdown file. rmd2word: create Word documents accessible PDF files. install_otp: convenience function install OfficeToPDF, create PDF files Word documents rmd2word. ext_img: function enable knitr chunk options .width /.height work output format Word document rmd2ioslides: create ioslides presentations perhaps print (non-accessible) PDF documents. rmd2slidy: create slidy presentations perhaps print (non-accessible) PDF documents.. rmd2html: create html documents perhaps print (non-accessible) PDF documents. rmd2? functions provide option create zip archive containing output files.  .Rmd files directory can processed one function call. Information title, author, lang etc YAML header Rmd file used output ignored.

title: accessr: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R markdown — accessr-package
text: David Gohel Noam Ross (2021). officedown: Enhanced 'R Markdown' Format 'Word' 'PowerPoint'. R package version 0.3.1. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=officedown JJ Allaire, Yihui Xie, Christophe Dervieux, Jonathan McPherson, Javier Luraschi, Kevin Ushey, Aron Atkins, Hadley Wickham, Joe Cheng, Winston Chang, Richard Iannone (2024). rmarkdown: Dynamic Documents R. R package version 2.26, https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.

title: accessr: Command Line Tools to Produce Accessible Documents using R markdown — accessr-package
text: Maintainer: Paul J. Northrop p.northrop@ucl.ac.uk [copyright holder]

what: External images for Word output — ext_img
title: External images for Word output — ext_img
text: modified version external_img function officer package use rmd2word. modification allow use knitr chunk options .width /.height set dimensions figure (R-generated external image) output format Word document. functionality normally available.

title: External images for Word output — ext_img
code: ext_img(src, width = 0.5, height = 0.2, alt = "", ref_docx_dim)

title: External images for Word output — ext_img
text: src image file path width width inches height height inches alt alternative text images ref_docx_dim list containing components page (named numeric vector containing width height), landscape (logical vector) margins (named numeric vector containing top, bottom, left, right, header footer margins). See Details.

title: External images for Word output — ext_img
text: object class c("external_img", "cot", "run") attributes "dims" (named list containing figure's width height) "alt" (character scalar containing alternative text figure).

title: External images for Word output — ext_img
text: current R code chunk .width .height set corresponding values fig.width fig.height inferred dimensions figure page dimensions output Word document. former obtained using readPNG readJPEG appropriate.  one .width .height set aspect ratio figure preserved. ref_docx_dim can produced using officer::docx_dim(officer::read_docx(doc)), doc docx_dim object docx_dim read_docx functions officer package.

title: External images for Word output — ext_img
text: function designed use inside rmd2word object returned structure returned external_img. Outside context knitr R code chunk outputs external_img ext_img identical.

title: External images for Word output — ext_img
code: # Example from the officer::external_img() documentation # Wrap R logo with external_img ---- srcfile <- file.path( R.home("doc"), "html", "logo.jpg" ) extimg <- ext_img(src = srcfile, height = 1.06 / 2, width = 1.39 / 2)

title: Install OfficeToPDF — install_otp
text: Downloads OfficeToPDF.exe https://github.com/cognidox/OfficeToPDF/releases copies suitable location, default system.file(package = "accessr").

title: Install OfficeToPDF — install_otp
code: install_otp(dir, url, method, quiet = TRUE, ...)

title: Install OfficeToPDF — install_otp
text: dir Directory download executable file OfficeToPDF.exe. argument must supplied. Pass dir = "accessr" choose accessr package directory, , system.file(package = "accessr"). choice enable OfficeToPDF.exe found may problem .libPaths refers cloud storage directory, OneDrive. dir supplied, e.g. call install_otp(), error thrown dir = "accessr" suggested. url URL download OfficeToPDF.exe.  missing https://github.com/cognidox/OfficeToPDF/releases/download/v1.9.0.2/OfficeToPDF.exe used. method Passed download.file.  missing getOption("download.file.method") used set . quiet Passed download.file. quiet controls whether messages printed download. ... Additional arguments passed download.file.

title: Install OfficeToPDF — install_otp
text: See Value section download.file.

title: Install OfficeToPDF — install_otp
text: argument mode = "wb" download.file hard-coded, binary transfer forced.

title: Install OfficeToPDF — install_otp
text: OfficeToPDF.exe used create PDF files Word documents rmd2word.

what: Converts R markdown code to html documents — rmd2html
title: Converts R markdown code to html documents — rmd2html
text: Creates accessible html documents using R markdown's html_document argument render. Zip archives html files may created.

title: Converts R markdown code to html documents — rmd2html
code: rmd2html(   x,   zip = if (length(x) == 1 & !add) FALSE else TRUE,   pdf = FALSE,   pdf_args = list(),   zip_pdf = zip,   add = FALSE,   quiet = TRUE,   rm_html = FALSE,   rm_pdf = FALSE,   ... )

title: Converts R markdown code to html documents — rmd2html
text: x character vector containing names (extension) .Rmd files convert  current working directory, paths files, either absolute relative current working directory, e.g., DIRECTORY/file1.  .html files created directory respective .Rmd file.  x missing html file created .Rmd files current working directory. zip logical scalar character vector indicating whether html files put zip archive.  zip = FALSE zip archive created.  Otherwise, archive created unique directory involved x.  zip = TRUE archive html files named accessr_html.zip.  zip character vector zip file names (extension) names used name zip archives.  names recycled length number unique directories, necessary. pdf logical scalar.  pdf = TRUE html file printed PDF file using chrome_print. Google Chrome (alternative browser specified pdf_args browser argument chrome_print) must installed prior use option. error message like Error servr::random_port(NULL) : find available TCP   port means random_port function servr package find internet connection Chrome considers secure. title: Converts R markdown code to html documents — rmd2html
text: addition creating html files, perhaps zip files, list containing following (character vector) components returned invisibly: files (absolute) paths file names files added zip file. zips (relative) paths names zip files.

title: Converts R markdown code to html documents — rmd2html
text: Information title, author, lang etc YAML header Rmd file used output ignored. simplest setup .Rmd files current working directory, case rmd2html() create HTML documents Rmd files, .Rmd files may different directories. render function, argument output_file = html_document creates html files.

title: Converts R markdown code to html documents — rmd2html
code: # Create an HTML document from example.Rmd got_hux <- requireNamespace("huxtable", quietly = TRUE) got_flex <- requireNamespace("flextable", quietly = TRUE) got_pandoc <- rmarkdown::pandoc_available("1.14") got_all <- got_hux && got_flex && got_pandoc # This example needs packages huxtable and flextable if (got_all) {   ex_file <- system.file(package = "accessr", "examples", "example.Rmd")   file.copy(ex_file, tdir <- tempdir(check = TRUE), overwrite = TRUE)   ex_file <- list.files(tdir, pattern = "example.Rmd", full.names = TRUE)   ex_file <- sub(".Rmd", "", ex_file)   rmd2html(ex_file) }

title: Converts R markdown code to ioslides html presentations — rmd2ioslides

title: Converts R markdown code to ioslides html presentations — rmd2ioslides
text: Information title, author, lang etc YAML header Rmd file used output ignored. simplest setup .Rmd files current working directory, case rmd2ioslides() create ioslides presentations Rmd files, .Rmd files may different directories. render function, argument output_file = ioslides_presentation creates ioslides html files. function ioslides_presentation argument slide_level sets header level used slide separator. Lua filter ioslides_presentation.lua rmarkdown package uses content headers level slide_level create segue slide, grey background intended contain section heading. particular, default, slide_level = 2, content level one header # next level two header ## formatted separate grey segue slide. want segue slides must avoid using level one headers. However, reasons document accessibility, may want use level one headers separate slides. example, wish create ioslides presentation Word document source Rmd file Word document meet fully accessibility requirements headings document start level one. rmarkdown version 2.26, passing slide_level = 1 ioslides_presentation force new non-segue slide level one header # used: places content # next ## grey segue slide behaviour content resulting slides intended. Passing slide_level = 1 rmd2ioslides() replaces rmarkdown's Lua filter ioslides_presentation.lua one modified, passing slide_level = 1 start new non-segue slide. modified default.css css file also used adjusts font sizes header levels accordingly, level one header larger font level two header. values slide_level greater equal 2, ioslides_presentation behave usual. slide_level supplied slide_level = 1 used.

title: Converts R markdown code to ioslides html presentations — rmd2ioslides
code: # Create an ioslides presentation from example.Rmd got_hux <- requireNamespace("huxtable", quietly = TRUE) got_flex <- requireNamespace("flextable", quietly = TRUE) got_pandoc <- rmarkdown::pandoc_available("1.14") got_all <- got_hux && got_flex && got_pandoc # This example needs packages huxtable and flextable if (got_all) {   ex_file <- system.file(package = "accessr", "examples", "example.Rmd")   file.copy(ex_file, tdir <- tempdir(check = TRUE), overwrite = TRUE)   ex_file <- list.files(tdir, pattern = "example.Rmd", full.names = TRUE)   ex_file <- sub(".Rmd", "", ex_file)   rmd2ioslides(ex_file) }

title: Create content in multiple formats — rmd2many
text: x character vector containing names (extension) .Rmd files convert current working directory, paths files, either absolute relative current working directory, e.g., DIRECTORY/file1.  output files created directory respective .Rmd file. outputs character vector. Specifies output formats required. subset c("word", "ioslides", "slidy", "html"). one "ioslides", "slidy" "html" present one used order preference "ioslides", "slidy" "html". slide_level Passed rmd2ioslides via .... default slide_level = 1 means level one header # create new non-segue slide ioslides presentation. css argument css passed ioslides_presentation slidy_presentation. css = "black" accessr's css file black.css used, results black text used slides. css used outputs = html. add18 logical scalar. TRUE also create Word documents 18pt text. pdf logical scalar. TRUE use chrome_print print PDF versions HTML files produced using output "ioslides" "slidy". /OfficeToPDF.exe create PDF files Word documents produced. highlight named list, names subset c("word", "ioslides", "slidy"), providing respective syntax highlighting styles passed Pandoc output formats. syntax highlighting provided css take precedence. highlight used outputs = html. params list named parameters pass argument params render. example , file example.Rmd parameter hide. hide = TRUE parts output hidden using knitr chunk options echo eval. zip logical scalar character vector indicating whether PDF files put zip archive.  zip = FALSE zip archive created.  Otherwise, archive created unique directory involved x.  zip = TRUE archive created named first filename x relevant directory. zip character vector zip file names (extension) names used name zip archives.  names recycled length number unique directories necessary. ... Additional arguments passed rmd2ioslides, rmd2slidy, rmd2word rmd2html.

title: Create content in multiple formats — rmd2many
text: list containing following components: files names files created. zips names zip files created (zip = TRUE).

title: Create content in multiple formats — rmd2many
text: default setting creates, valid filename x, following files filename.html: lecture slides ioslides format. filename_slides.pdf: PDF document containing content filename.html. filename.pdf: PDF document created Word document produced rmd2word. filename.docx: Word document. filename18pt.docx: Word document. add18 = TRUE template Word document 18pt bold text used. filename.zip: zip file containing files produced.

title: Create content in multiple formats — rmd2many
code: # Create documents from example.Rmd got_hux <- requireNamespace("huxtable", quietly = TRUE) got_flex <- requireNamespace("flextable", quietly = TRUE) got_pandoc <- rmarkdown::pandoc_available("1.14") got_all <- got_hux && got_flex && got_pandoc # This example needs packages huxtable and flextable # We pass pdf = FALSE because OfficeToPDF is needed to convert Word to PDF # and this is only relevant on a Windows Operating System. # if (got_all) {   ex_file <- system.file(package = "accessr", "examples", "example.Rmd")   file.copy(ex_file, tdir <- tempdir(check = TRUE), overwrite = TRUE)   ex_file <- list.files(tdir, pattern = "example.Rmd", full.names = TRUE)   ex_file <- sub(".Rmd", "", ex_file)   rmd2many(ex_file, params = list(hide = TRUE), pdf = FALSE, zip = TRUE) } #> $files #> [1] "C:/Users/Paul/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpsLiJGU/example.html"     #> [2] "C:/Users/Paul/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpsLiJGU/example18pt.docx" #> [3] "C:/Users/Paul/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpsLiJGU/example.docx"     #>  #> $zips #> [1] "C:/Users/Paul/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpsLiJGU/example.zip" #>

title: Converts R markdown code to Word and PDF documents — rmd2word
text: Information title, author, lang etc YAML header Rmd file used output ignored. simplest setup .Rmd files current working directory, case rmd2word() create Word documents Rmd files, .Rmd files may different directories. possible .Rmd files different directories, non-"default" values doc must reference_docx argument word_document finds template Word file. template directory respective .Rmd component  x filename, e.g. "template.docx" suffice.  Otherwise, path template given, either relative directory .Rmd file sits, absolute path. information create template Word document see Richard Layton's guide Happy collaboration Rmd docx. built-template options: doc = "officedown": uses rdocx_document's default, doc = "accessr": similar "officedown" narrower margins black text titles darker hyperlinks, avoid contrast issues, doc = "18": like "accessr" 18pt text, doc = "exam": creates Word file header "Examination paper STAT0002" left "Page x n" right. use template(s), provide filename(s). component equal "officedown" chooses rdocx_document's default. component equal "accessr" chooses accessr's internal template file, narrower margins darker blue fonts titles hyperlinks, avoid contrast issues.  use template(s), provide filenames.  See Details information. render function creates Word file input .Rmd file.  OfficeToPDF used convert Word file PDF file.  file OfficeToPDF.exe needs downloaded OfficeToPDF releases page placed directory specified argument dir, directory list returned searchpaths. OfficeToPDF.exe found error thrown. warning given PDF files produced. occur existing PDF file name open another application.

title: Converts R markdown code to Word and PDF documents — rmd2word
text: Layton, Richard. (2015) Happy collaboration Rmd docx. R Markdown RStudio article. https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/articles_docx.html

title: Converts R markdown code to Word and PDF documents — rmd2word
code: # Create a Word file from example.Rmd got_hux <- requireNamespace("huxtable", quietly = TRUE) got_flex <- requireNamespace("flextable", quietly = TRUE) got_pandoc <- rmarkdown::pandoc_available("1.14") got_all <- got_hux && got_flex && got_pandoc # This example needs packages huxtable and flextable # We pass pdf = FALSE because OfficeToPDF is needed to convert Word to PDF # and this is only relevant on a Windows Operating System. if (got_all) {   ex_file <- system.file(package = "accessr", "examples", "example.Rmd")   file.copy(ex_file, tdir <- tempdir(check = TRUE), overwrite = TRUE)   ex_file <- list.files(tdir, pattern = "example.Rmd", full.names = TRUE)   ex_file <- sub(".Rmd", "", ex_file)   rmd2word(ex_file, pdf = FALSE) }
